definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to expand production/to reproduce on an extended scale

sentences.english: Time before-production is generally used for the machine settings and time after-production for cleaning.
sentences.chinese: 生产前时间通常被用来机械调整和时再生产前清洁。

sentences.english: We had to retool for enlarging reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 为了扩大再生产，我们必须更换机械设备。

sentences.english: Production and current it is two in social reproduction process important segment.
sentences.chinese: 生产和流通是社会再生产过程中的两个重要环节。

sentences.english: The vivid reproductions bring words and ideas to life.
sentences.chinese: 生动的再生产带来词和想法给生活。

sentences.english: A year later, the male fathead minnows were producing eggs and had largely stopped reproducing.
sentences.chinese: 一年后，公傻瓜鲤科小鱼生产蛋和主要停止了再生产。

sentences.english: Can of course, well, you should not do so we must learn to reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 能当然好，不能呢那么你就要学会再生产。

sentences.english: This means the cells can keep growing and reproducing indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着这种细胞可以持续生长并且无限再生产。

sentences.english: The essence of accounting is depicting the number and volume of production and reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 会计的本质是反映生产或再生产中的数与量。

definition: to produce/to manufacture/to give birth to a child
to expand production/to reproduce on an extended scale
relations between levels of production/socio-economic relations
